summary: This document is an email chain between defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim and prosecutors regarding scheduling the trial date for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The defense argues for a November 8, 2021 trial start, citing Maxwell's detention and potential juror impatience if the trial extends into the holidays, while the prosecution proposes November 29, 2021. The defense also links scheduling flexibility to the prosecution consenting to Maxwell's release on bail.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Lead defense counsel corresponding with prosecutors to schedule Maxwell's trial, advocating for a November 8 start date and linking scheduling to bail.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell; her defense team cites her extended detention and its effect on her health as reasons for an earlier trial date.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: A prosecutor copied on the email correspondence regarding trial scheduling for the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: A prosecutor copied on the email correspondence regarding trial scheduling for the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Defense attorney for Maxwell; her scheduling conflict with a civil trial on December 13 is mentioned as something she will try to move.

events.title: Proposed Defense Trial Start Date
events.description: The defense's "earliest and preferred" date to begin the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell, as argued in their April 22 letter.

events.title: Proposed Prosecution Trial Start Date
events.description: The date the prosecution plans to propose for the start of Maxwell's trial, after considering witness and counsel availability.

events.title: Defense Letter-Motion Filed
events.description: The defense filed a letter-motion (Dkt. 246) providing specific details to justify a request for a continuance to November 8.

events.title: Laura Menninger's Conflicting Civil Trial
events.description: Defense attorney Laura Menninger has a civil trial scheduled for this date, which she will try to move to accommodate the Maxwell trial.

locations: Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim (West 19th Street office, currently closed due to Covid-19)
keyFacts: The defense strongly advocated for a November 8, 2021 trial start for Ghislaine Maxwell, citing her extended detention and its negative impact on her health.
The defense explicitly linked greater scheduling flexibility to the prosecution agreeing to Maxwell's release on bail pending trial.
The prosecution countered with a proposal to start the trial on November 29, 2021, citing the need to consider witness and counsel availability.
The defense expressed concern that a trial starting late November and extending into the Christmas/New Year holidays would cast the defense in a negative light with impatient jurors.
The email chain reveals ongoing procedural negotiations, including deadlines for disclosing victim identities and defense expert disclosures.
